description: The round payoff this round was 3. You, Kate chose to play option 2.John chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -3000.

Mutual defection (both choosing option 2) results in catastrophic penalties (-1000×input), making cooperation (option 1) critical to avoid massive losses (due to the -3000 payoff example and payoff structure).
Defecting (option 2) introduces high risk, as the other player (John) may unpredictably defect despite a default of option 1, leading to severe mutual losses (evidenced by the 2024-01-02 memory).
Short-term gains from unilateral defection (+input) are outweighed by the risk of triggering mutual defection’s extreme penalties, incentivizing consistent cooperation (option 1).
